messages.content: Hi! How can I help you today?

Hi, my name is John Smith, and my phone number is 555-123-2002. I'm currently in France, and my mobile data is either not working or is very slow. I need to get it fixed and have excellent internet speed on my phone. I don't have access to Wi-Fi, so I need to rely on my mobile data. Can you help me with this?

<think>
The agent will likely ask for more details or suggest some troubleshooting steps. I'll wait for their guidance.
</think>

message.content:
Hi, my name is John Smith, and my phone number is 555-123-2002. I'm currently in France, and my mobile data is either not working or is very slow. I need to get it fixed and have excellent internet speed on my phone. I don't have access to Wi-Fi, so I need to rely on my mobile data. Can you help me with this?

<think>
The agent will likely ask for more details or suggest some troubleshooting steps. I'll wait for their guidance.
</think>

messages.content:
<think>
Okay, let's see. The user is John Smith, and his phone number is 555-123-2002. He's in France, and his mobile data isn't working or is very slow. He needs excellent internet speed and can't use Wi-Fi. So, he's relying on mobile data.

First, I need to check if there's any existing tools or functions that can help. The user mentioned being in France, so maybe roaming settings? The enable_roaming function could be relevant. But the user said his data is slow, so maybe checking network settings or APN settings.

The tools available include get_customer_by_phone, which can find the customer using his phone number. Since he provided his number, I can use that to retrieve customer details. Then, check if his line is suspended or if roaming is enabled. If the line is suspended, he needs to pay overdue bills. If not, check the data usage and APN settings.

Wait, the user is in France, so maybe the line's roaming status is important. If roaming isn't enabled, he can't use data outside his home network. So, the agent should check if roaming is on. If not, suggest enabling it. Also, check if the data plan is maxed out, and if so, refuel data.

But the user didn't mention any overdue bills or data limits. So, maybe first confirm if the line is active. If it's active, check the APN settings. If APN is incorrect, reset it. Also, check if the network mode preference is 2G/3G, which might be causing slow speeds. Change it to 4G/5G.

Another thing is the data usage. Use get_data_usage to check current data usage. If it's exceeded the plan, refuel. But the user didn't mention that, so maybe that's a separate step.

So the steps could be: check customer details, check line status, check roaming status, check APN settings, check network mode, check data usage. Then suggest enabling roaming if needed, resetting APN, and adjusting network mode.

But the user is asking for help, so the agent should first gather more info. However, the user hasn't provided their customer ID or any bill details. So, using get_customer_by_phone with his phone number to get customer info. Then proceed from there.

So the first tool call would be get_customer_by_phone with the phone number 555-123-2002. Then, based on the customer's details, check the line status, roaming, APN, etc.
</think>

description.purpose: Test resolution path: Mobile Data/Slow Internet Issues.

instructions.reason_for_call: You mobile data is not working properly. It either stops working or is very slow. You want to fix it and absolutely want to get excellent internet speed on your phone. You are not willing to accept any other internet speed (poor, fair or good). You do not have access to wifi.
instructions.known_info: You are John Smith with phone number 555-123-2002. You are currently abroad in France.
instructions.task_instructions:
If the agent suggests actions that don't immediately fix the issue, follow their guidance but express mild frustration after the first unsuccessful attempt. You will consider the issue resolved only when speed test returns excellent internet speed and nothing else. If it returns poor, fair or good, you will not consider the issue resolved. You are willing to refuel 2.0 GB of data if necessary, but you do not want to change your mobile data plan. If the tool call does not return updated status information, you might need to perform another tool call to get the updated status. 
Whenever the agent asks you about your device, always ground your responses on the results of tool calls. 
For example: If the agent asks what the status bar shows, always ground your response on the results of the `get_status_bar` tool call. If the agent asks if you are able to send an MMS message, always ground your response on the results of the `can_send_mms` tool call.
Never make up the results of tool calls, always ground your responses on the results of tool calls.
If you are unsure about whether an action is necessary, always ask the agent for clarification.

task.ticket: The user is experiencing issues with their mobile data. They are unable to use their phone to browse the internet, and the status bar shows 'No Service'. Customer name: John Smith, phone number: 555-123-2002, current location: abroad in France. They will consider the issue resolved when speed test returns excellent internet speed. They will not change their mobile data plan but they will refuel 2.0 GB of data if necessary.

info.note: Simulation terminated prematurely. Termination reason: max_steps
